snippet: Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta sought to persuade a skeptical audience of Asian officials that the United States is committed to enhancing its military presence in the region.
abstract: United States Defense Secretary Leon E Panetta outlines plan to expand the US military presence in the Asia-Pacific region, despite coming budget restraints; says 60 percent of the Navy's assets will be assigned to the Pacific Ocean, fortified by an increase in the number and size of military exercises in the region, and a greater number of port visits.
lead_paragraph: Defense Secretary Leon E. Panetta sought to persuade a skeptical audience of Asian officials that the United States is committed to enhancing its military presence in the region.

headline.seo: Leon Panetta Outlines New Weaponry for Pacific
